title: Too much or too little AI adoption may lower workers' job satisfaction
description: In research based on 2009–2020 data from 509 publicly listed US firms, lower and higher levels of adoption of artificial intelligence (AI) were associated with reduced job satisfaction, whereas moderate levels were linked to greater job satisfaction. The findings are published in the Journal of Management Studies.
content: In research based on 2009–2020 data from 509 publicly listed US firms, lower and higher levels of adoption of artificial intelligence (AI) were associated with reduced job satisfaction, whereas moderate levels were linked to greater job satisfaction.... [1173 chars]

title: Stronger safeguards needed as AI healthcare grows, WHO Europe warns
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark — The growing use of artificial intelligence in healthcare necessitates stronger legal and ethical safeguards to protect patients and healthcare workers, the World Health Organization's Europe branch said in a report published Wednesday.

title: Asian shares retreat in cautious trading ahead of Nvidia's profit report
description: Asian shares are mostly lower in cautious trading after worries about Nvidia and the overall market frenzy over artificial intelligence technology sent Wall Street stocks lower
content:
TOKYO (AP) — Asian shares have retreated in cautious trading Wednesday ahead of an earnings report from Nvidia that is seen as a bellwether for the recent craze for artificial intelligence technology.

content:

title: Trump warns against AI 'overregulation,' says US needs to have one federal standard
description: 'Overregulation by the States is threatening to undermine this Growth Engine,' US President Trump says of artificial intelligence on social media
content: WASHINGTON, USA – President Donald Trump said on Tuesday, Novembr 18, the US must have one federal standard for regulating artificial intelligence, saying the technology risked being over-regulated if each American state came up with its own standard... [1123 chars]

title: Elon Musk Chases $15 Billion Funding Round For xAI At Whopping $230 Billion Valuation - More Than Double Its Worth After X Acquisition
description: Elon Musk's artificial-intelligence firm xAI is reportedly in advanced talks to raise $15 billion, which will more than double its valuation.
content:
Elon Musk‘s artificial-intelligence company, xAI, is in advanced talks to raise $15 billion in new equity at a $230 billion valuation, according to a report published late Tuesday.

title: ‘YUVA AI for ALL’: Govt launches free course to help citizens learn Artificial Intelligence, details inside
